template.name: Template App PFSense SNMP
template.description:
Template for monitoring pfSense by SNMP Setup: 1. Enable SNMP daemon at Services in pfSense web interface https://docs.netgate.com/pfsense/en/latest/services/snmp.html 2. Setup firewall rule to get access from Zabbix proxy or Zabbix server by SNMP https://docs.netgate.com/pfsense/en/latest/firewall/index.html#managing-firewall-rules 3. Link template to the host
MIBs used: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB UCD-DISKIO-MIB UCD-SNMP-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.39

item.name: PFSense: ICMP ping
item.description: Host accessibility by ICMP. 0 - ICMP ping fails. 1 - ICMP ping successful.

trigger.name: PFSense: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

item.name: PFSense: ICMP loss
item.description: Percentage of lost packets.

item.name: PFSense: ICMP response time
item.description: ICMP ping response time (in seconds).

trigger.name: PFSense: High ICMP ping response time
trigger.description: Average ICMP response time is too big.

item.name: PFSense: DHCP server status
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The status of DHCP server process.

trigger.name: PFSense: DHCP server is not running

item.name: PFSense: DNS server status
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The status of DNS server process.

trigger.name: PFSense: DNS server is not running

item.name: PFSense: State of nginx process
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The status of nginx process.

trigger.name: PFSense: Web server is not running

item.name: PFSense: Packets with bad offset
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Fragmented packets
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Packets matched a filter rule
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Packets dropped due to memory limitation
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Normalized packets
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Short packets
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Packet filter running status
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if packet filter is currently enabled.

trigger.name: PFSense: Packet filter is not running

item.name: PFSense: Firewall rules count
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of labeled filter rules on this system.

item.name: PFSense: Source tracking table current
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB Number of entries in the source tracking table.

item.name: PFSense: Source tracking table limit
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB Maximum number of 'sticky-address' or 'source-track' rules in the ruleset.

item.name: PFSense: Source tracking table utilization in %
item.description: Utilization of source tracking table in %.

trigger.name: PFSense: Source tracking table usage more than {$SOURCE.TRACKING.TABLE.UTIL.MAX}.
trigger.description: Please check the number of sticky connections https://docs.netgate.com/pfsense/en/latest/monitoring/status/firewall-states-sources.html.

item.name: PFSense: States table current
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB Number of entries in the state table.

item.name: PFSense: States table limit
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB Maximum number of 'keep state' rules in the ruleset.

item.name: PFSense: States table utilization in %
item.description: Utilization of state table in %.

trigger.name: PFSense: State table usage more than {$STATE.TABLE.UTIL.MAX}.
trigger.description: Please check the number of connections https://docs.netgate.com/pfsense/en/latest/config/advanced-firewall-nat.html#config-advanced-firewall-maxstates.

item.name: PFSense: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: PFSense: Interrupts per second
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Number of interrupts processed.

item.name: PFSense: Load average (1m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The 1 minute load averages.

item.name: PFSense: Load average (15m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The 15 minutes load averages.

item.name: PFSense: Load average (5m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The 5 minutes load averages.

item.name: PFSense: Number of CPUs
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB Count the number of CPU cores by counting number of cores discovered in hrProcessorTable using LLD.

step.params: //count the number of cores return JSON.parse(value).length;

item.name: PFSense: Context switches per second
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Number of context switches.

item.name: PFSense: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB System description of the host.

item.name: PFSense: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node. If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: PFSense: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB System host name.

trigger.name: PFSense: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: PFSense: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining what kind of box is being managed.

item.name: PFSense: Free swap space
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of swap space currently unused or available.

item.name: PFSense: Free swap space in %
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in percent.

item.name: PFSense: Total swap space
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The total amount of swap space configured for this host.

item.name: PFSense: Uptime
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB System uptime in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

item.name: PFSense: Available memory
item.description: Please note that memory utilization is a rough estimate, since memory available is calculated as free+buffers+cached, which is not 100% accurate, but the best we can get using SNMP.

item.name: PFSense: Memory (buffers)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as memory buffers.

item.name: PFSense: Memory (cached)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as cached memory.

item.name: PFSense: Free memory
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of real/physical memory currently unused or available.

item.name: PFSense: Total memory
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Total memory in Bytes.

item.name: PFSense: Memory utilization
item.description: Please note that memory utilization is a rough estimate, since memory available is calculated as free+buffers+cached, which is not 100% accurate, but the best we can get using SNMP.

trigger.name: PFSense: High memory utilization (>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

dependency.name: PFSense: Lack of available memory (<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Template App PFSense SNMP:vm.memory.available.min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template App PFSense SNMP:vm.memory.total.last()}>0

item.name: PFSense: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: PFSense: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

discovery_rule.name: CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: This discovery will create set of per core CPU metrics from UCD-SNMP-MIB, using {#CPU.COUNT} in preprocessing. That's the only reason why LLD is used.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: CPU idle time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: CPU interrupt time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: PFSense: CPU iowait time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: PFSense: CPU nice time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: PFSense: CPU system time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: PFSense: CPU user time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: PFSense: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: CPU utilization in %.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

step.params: //count the number of CPU cores return JSON.stringify([{"{#CPU.COUNT}": value, "{#SNMPINDEX}": 0, "{#SINGLETON}":""}])

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv4 traffic blocked
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv4 bits per second blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv4 packets blocked
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv4 packets blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv6 traffic blocked
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv6 bits per second blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv6 packets blocked
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv6 packets blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv4 traffic passed
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv4 bits per second passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv4 packets passed
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv4 packets passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv6 traffic passed
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv6 bits per second passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv6 packets passed
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv6 packets passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv4 traffic blocked
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv4 bits per second blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv4 packets blocked
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv4 packets blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv6 traffic blocked
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv6 bits per second blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv6 packets blocked
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv6 packets blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv4 traffic passed
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv4 bits per second passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv4 packets passed
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv4 packets passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv6 traffic passed
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv6 bits per second passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv6 packets passed
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv6 packets passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Rules references count
item_prototype.description: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of rules referencing this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Link down
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}].change()}<0 and {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0 and ( {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=6 or {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=7 or {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=11 or {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=62 or {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=69 or {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=117 ) and {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}<>2
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}].change()}>0 and {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}].last(#2)}>0) or {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2
trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.in[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High inbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.out[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template App PFSense SNMP:net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High outbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

graph_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound packet filter traffic
PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound packet filter traffic

discovery_rule.name: Block devices discovery
discovery_rule.description: Block devices are discovered from UCD-DISKIO-MIB::diskIOTable (http://net-snmp.sourceforge.net/docs/mibs/ucdDiskIOMIB.html#diskIOTable)

item_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#DEVNAME}]: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The number of read accesses from this device since boot.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#DEVNAME}]: Disk utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The 1 minute average load of disk (%).

item_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#DEVNAME}]: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The number of write accesses from this device since boot.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Free inodes in %
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB If having problems collecting this item make sure access to UCD-SNMP-MIB is allowed.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

dependency.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

item_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Space utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB If having problems collecting this item make sure access to UCD-SNMP-MIB is allowed.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB If having problems collecting this item make sure access to UCD-SNMP-MIB is allowed.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB If having problems collecting this item make sure access to UCD-SNMP-MIB is allowed.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.total[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.used[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.total[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.used[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<10G or {Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: PFSense: [{#FSNAME}]: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
dependency.expression: {Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.total[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.used[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template App PFSense SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

macro.description: Threshold of CPU utilization for warning trigger in %.
Threshold of ICMP packets loss for warning trigger in %.
Threshold of average ICMP response time for warning trigger in seconds.
Threshold of error packets rate for warning trigger. Can be used with interface name as context.
Threshold of interface bandwidth utilization for warning trigger in %. Can be used with interface name as context.
Macro for operational state of the interface for link down trigger. Can be used with interface name as context.
Load per CPU considered sustainable. Tune if needed.
Threshold of available memory for trigger in bytes.
Threshold of memory utilization for trigger in %
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
Ignore down(2) administrative status
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
Ignore notPresent(6)
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
The time interval for SNMP availability trigger.
Threshold of source tracking table utilization trigger in %.
Threshold of state table utilization trigger in %.
Threshold of free swap space for warning trigger in %.
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
Threshold of inodes usage for average severity trigger in %. Can be used with filesystem name as context.
Threshold of inodes usage for warning trigger in %. Can be used with filesystem name as context.
Threshold of filesystem used space for average severity trigger in %. Can be used with filesystem name as context.
Threshold of used filesystem space for warning trigger in %. Can be used with filesystem name as context.

trigger.expression: {Template App PFSense SNMP:system.swap.pfree.min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN} and {Template App PFSense SNMP:system.swap.total.last()}>0
trigger.name: PFSense: High swap space usage (less than {$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN}% free)
trigger.description: This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured.

dependency.name: PFSense: Lack of available memory (<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Template App PFSense SNMP:vm.memory.available.min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template App PFSense SNMP:vm.memory.total.last()}>0

trigger.expression: {Template App PFSense SNMP:vm.memory.available.min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template App PFSense SNMP:vm.memory.total.last()}>0
trigger.name: PFSense: Lack of available memory (<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger.description: The system is running out of memory

trigger.name: PFSense: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.
